body: @nikhilbhide, can you please close this PR? It seems like it was created by mistake.
Thanks for the PR, LGTM.
LGTM
@hachikuji, does this look good to you?
@guozhangwang, shall we close this for now?
@fpj Do you intend to get this integrated into the 0.9.0 branch?
LGTM, merged it to the 0.9.0 branch. @auradkar can you please close the PR (the automatic close only works for trunk and we can't close it manually).
@pyr, can you please close this PR since #1098 superseded it?
@ijuma thanks!
@bondj, the gist of the change seems fine. Can you please address @ewencp's two comments? I'll merge it to trunk once you do.
@rajinisivaram, can you please rebase this? I'll merge it once you do.
This has been fixed via a different PR. @thomaslee, can you please close the PR?
@rekhajoshm, can you please rebase and target the trunk branch?
@fpj can you please check this small PR?
@SinghAsDev, can you please update the PR title and description to match what's actually in the PR?

@rajinisivaram, I ran the unit/integration tests with this branch twice and both times I got some failures in SASL tests. Do the tests pass reliably for you? Is it possible that a recent change is causing issues?
Thanks @guozhangwang

Thanks @granthenke. Aside from a few minor comments, LGTM. I started a system tests build here:

https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/415/console
@guozhangwang For now I'd recommend waiting on merging this PR until we have more evidence that this is a problem in practice.

@ijuma The tests have been passing consistently for me. I reran them again a few times after rebasing on the latest level and they still pass. If you let me know which tests have been failing for you, I can rerun those in a loop to see if I can recreate the failure. Will also see how the automated PR build does after the rebase. Thanks.
LGTM

@rajinisivaram, thanks. I am running the tests again in case it was a mistake on my end. If they pass in Jenkins and locally, I'll merge the PR (I checked with Jun and he's happy with it). If not, I'll provide information about the failing tests.
@ijuma I updated the patch based on your feedback
Thanks @granthenke, LGTM. @gwenshap, do you want to take a look as well?

The failing tests were related to the flaky wireless network in the Kafka Summit, I got the same failure with SSL tests (where SASL wasn't involved). After I stabilised the network, the tests passed twice and they passed in Jenkins too.

Merged to trunk.
Looks perfect. I was waiting for you to finish nitpicking tests ;)
@ijuma I believe all review comments are addressed now. Mind taking a look again?

@ijuma , sorry for the delay. My unfamiliarity with Scala language might be a hindrance here. Could someone else help with the test cases updates. Also, it would be nice to consolidate the regex in one place in code (instead of at 3 places).
E.g. Windows IPV6 address that was failing before: fe80::d415:51c8:6018:38a2%3
@SinghAsDev, can you please merge trunk into this branch as it no longer merges cleanly.
@ijuma done.
@ijuma seems like I messed up while rebasing, should be fixed now. Thanks for the reviews!
@fpj   pl go through KAFKA-3525 JIRA discussion.
LGTM
@ijuma  Pinging for review
Because this changes the UI for the console producer, it would be good to get a second opinion. @gwenshap maybe?
LGTM.
LGTM
@ewencp mind taking a look at this trivial patch.
@ewencp this should be good now, mind taking a look again?
@gwenshap @ijuma mind taking a look at this?
@harshach @ijuma @gwenshap pinging you guys for review here.
@ijuma does this look good now?
@SinghAsDev, looks good apart from one minor comment.
FYI #479 and the discussion on that jira is related to this. That pull requests covers both of these.
Thanks for the pointer @granthenke, I was not aware of it. Will close this and review #479 then.
@SinghAsDev This patch may be the preferred approach by the community, but I wanted to point out #479 since small updates like this was my motivation for the larger refactor.
LGTM! Nice catch. Merged to trunk.
I am fine with anything, if this patch is small enough and fine with committers then I can reopen it. Will wait for response from @ewencp or @ijuma.
@ijuma made the change, built and ran tests locally.
LGTM
LGTM. Thanks for the contribution!
@ijuma @gwenshap mind taking a look?

Yeah, it was by mistake.
Sorry for inconvenience. I have closed it.

Regards,
Nikhil

On Tue, Apr 26, 2016 at 9:41 PM, Ismael Juma notifications@github.com
wrote:

> @nikhilbhide https://github.com/nikhilbhide, can you please close this
> PR? It seems like it was created by mistake.
> 
> 
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1142#issuecomment-214844463
This is currently built on top of the PR for KAFKA-3617. The latest commit corresponds to this PR.
@SinghAsDev I think this needs notes added to `docs/upgrade.html` too since it includes breaking changes.
it might be worth it if we are to do a new release of the 0.9 branch. @ijuma
Closed in favor of https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1277 (which rebases the changes in this PR on latest Kafka trunk).
@guozhangwang feel free to review (/cc @enothereska and @mjsax ).
LGTM overall. Just a couple of minor comments.
@ijuma took care of the changes suggested. Mind giving it another pass?
Went through the open questions @miguno raised.
LGTM. Merged to trunk. Thanks @enothereska !
LGTM!
LGTM
LGTM
@ewencp good point, added note to upgrade doc.
Rebased on trunk.

@becketqin As a general rule, we should be very thorough with regards to performance testing whenever we introduce a new disk structure (like an index). I gave one example, but we should really also verify the impact on normal operations as well. Even if we believe that the impact should be minimal, we cannot be sure until we have tested it.
@miguno Could you address the second comment above? No further reviews needed after that.
@granders @ewencp @ijuma Would you be able to review this PR? Thank you.

@guozhangwang @miguno @enothereska Just updated this.

I just stepped through this again. What about `StreamsMetrics`, `StateRestoreCallback` and `ProcessorContext` interface? Should we extend the JavaDoc for them?

I reverted changes in `TumblindWindow` and `HoppingWindow` to avoid merge conflicts -> will be `TimeWindow` after #1277 got merged.

Should we try to get this two into the release, too? I did not address both in this PR to avoid conflicts.
- https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3440
- https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3574
@ijuma Thank you for the reviews. I have addressed most of them (all the easy ones :-)) and left comments for the others.
@SinghAsDev I think we should have some tests for this functionality.
Thank you @rajinisivaram, left some more comments. It seems like we're close.
I think we are keeping deprecated things around for a bit longer since 0.10 is so close to 0.9, but I could be wrong. cc @gwenshap

yeah, I wouldn't remove it right now.

Lets review the PR and merge it into trunk as soon as I do the last merge of trunk into 0.10.0. Should be tomorrow :)

@SinghAsDev: Mind explaining why you chose to plug in the validation where you did? 
Both why do you think a new state is needed and why do you think handleConnection() (which until now just did some metrics) is the correct place for the validation?
I'm pausing the line-level review until I have more clarity on the design decisions / scope.

is this going to be merged soon?
:+1:

@mjsax I can merge in #1277 first so that you can save the effort of javadocs for dropped classes. It will be great to extend the javadoc in those three classes as well; in order to not drag too long for this PR, let's do KAFKA-3440 / 3574 in separate PRs.

LGTM. cc @ijuma 

EDIT: I was not careful, the patch was actually modifying the wrong config.
@miguno could you have an initial look?

@Ishiihara In `build.gradle` we have a task called `systemTestLibs` that depends on some test jars. I think that might be because we have some tests that execute code that's in the test jars. I think @granders set that up so maybe he can clarify how that's used. My concern is that filtering out all the test jars might break some of those tests. If we need support for running some classes in test jars then we might need to make it possible to toggle this filtering on/off (though filtering out by default seems like a good choice).

@Ishiihara @ewencp 
Yeah I have the same concern - this may break a few tests which depend on classes in the test jar - e.g. the stream smoke tests.
@guozhangwang Ok. Whatever merge order is better. I will assign KAKFA-3440 und KAFKA-3574 to myself and open PRs for both ASAP if this is ok for you?

`systemTestLibs` was originally added because we need `minikdc` for the system tests. And then streams also started using this (as @granders said). It seems to me that we should have a variable that needs to be set for the test jars to be included. It is unexpected to have that as the default behaviour in my opinion.
An environmental variable to trigger addition of test jars seems reasonable
@ijuma @granders Agreed on the default behavior.
@ijuma Thanks for the review and offline discussion. I modified the PR according to offline discussion. and it seems the warning is gone. However, the implementation is quite Java like.
@ewencp @ijuma @granders Thanks for the review, I would add an environment variable to control test jar addition.
@ijuma Thank you for reviewing the updates. Have fixed most of them now and added comments for the remaining.
LGTM, thanks for cleaning this up since the warnings really look bad and could be confusing.
@ijuma @guozhangwang Increase the default to 5 minutes and updated the correct config this time.
Thanks for the review. Added a INCLUDE_TEST_JARS variable and change `filter_file` to `should_include_file` according to @granders suggestion.
LGTM
@Ishiihara but presumably this flag needs to be enabled in some of the system tests?

@Ishiihara Offhand, I think Minikdc service and streams-related services will need this flag (in system test code)

And then it would probably be good to run in a branch builder
LGTM
LGTM
